duck: gram definition: any of several leguminous plants (as a chickpea) grown especially for their seed.
Conversion of units - Conversion of units is the conversion between different units of measurement for the same quantity, typically through multiplicative conversion factors.
Gold gram - A gold gram is the amount of value represented by exactly one gram of gold.
Duella - A duella was an ancient Roman unit of weight, equivalent to a third of a Roman ounce.
The gram (alternative British English spelling: gramme; SI unit symbol: g) (Greek/Latin root grámma) is a metric system unit of mass.

wiki.text:
{{Infobox unit |name = Gram |image = |caption = The mass of this pen cap is
about 1 gram |standard = SI derived unit |quantity = Mass |symbol = g |dimension
= M |namedafter =
| units1 = SI base units inunits1 = 10<sup>-3</sup> kilograms units2 = CGS units
| inunits2 = 1 gram units3 = U.S. customary inunits3 = 0.0353 ounces
}} The 'gram' (alternative British English spelling: 'gramme';<ref></ref> SI
unit symbol: 'g') (Greek/Latin root grámma) is a metric system unit of mass.

Originally defined as "the absolute weight of a volume of pure water equal to
the cube of the hundredth part of a metre, and at the temperature of melting ice"<ref>[http://smdsi.quartier-
rural.org/histoire/18germ_3.htm Décret relatif aux poids et aux mesures],
1795</ref> (later 4 °C), a gram is now defined as one one-thousandth of the
SI base unit, the kilogram, or 1×10<sup>−3</sup> kg, which itself is defined as
being equal to the mass of a physical prototype preserved by the International
Bureau of Weights and Measures.
wiki.title: Gram
